SEARCH
Module fr.cyu
Package fr.cyu.chromatynk.parsing

Interface Parser<I,O>

Type Parameters:
I - the iterator input
O - the parser output
public interface Parser<I,O>
A parser that can be combined with others.

    • parse

      Parser.Result<O> parse(ParsingIterator<? extends I> iterator) throws ParsingException
      Parse the given input.
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator over the given input
      Returns:
      the parsed output
      Throws:
      ParsingException - if the parser fails to parse the given input

    • mapWithRange

      default <T> Parser<I,T> mapWithRange(ParsingBiFunction<Range,O,T> f)
      Decorate this parser with its range then apply the given function to this parser's output.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the output type of f
      Parameters:
      f - the function to apply
      Returns:
      a new parser equivalent to this one with f applied to the output

    • map

      default <T> Parser<I,T> map(ParsingFunction<O,T> f)
      Apply the given function to this parser's output.

      T - the output type of f
      Parameters:
      f - the function to apply
      Returns:
      a new parser equivalent to this one with f applied to the output

    • mapError

      default Parser<I,O> mapError(Function<ParsingException,? extends ParsingException> f)
      Map non-fatal errors thrown by this parser if any.
      Parameters:
      f - the function to apply to the eventually thrown error
      Returns:
      a new parser similar to this one but with f applied to any error thrown by it

    • fatal

      default Parser<I,O> fatal()
      Make this parser unrecoverable in case of error.
      Returns:
      this parser with its errors marked as fatal

    • valueWithRange

      default <T> Parser<I,T> valueWithRange(ParsingFunction<Range,T> f)
      Create a value from the parsed range if this parser succeeds.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the output type of f
      Parameters:
      f - the function to apply on the range
      Returns:
      a new parser equivalent to this one but with the result of f as output

    • optional

      default Parser<I,Optional<O>> optional()
      Make this parser optional.
      Returns:
      the same parser wrapping the result in a Optional` and recovering with `Optional.empty() in case of failure

    • repeat

      default Parser<I,List<O>> repeat()
      Repeat this parser until the first failure.
      Returns:
      the list of all the parsed results before the first failure

    • repeatUntil

      default Parser<I,List<O>> repeatUntil(Parser<I,?> parser)
      Repeat this parser until the given one succeeds.
      Parameters:
      parser - the parser signaling the end of the repetition
      Returns:
      a parser parsing zero or multiple outputs of this parser until it fails or parser succeeds

    • repeatReduce

      default Parser<I,O> repeatReduce(Parser<I,BiFunction<O,O,O>> reductionParser)
      Repeat and reduce this parser according to the reduction produced when parsing the separator. Useful for parsing binary operators in a recursion-friendly way.
      Parameters:
      reductionParser - the separator parser used to determine how to reduce two results in a single one
      Returns:
      a parser using this one to parser elements reduced according to the result of the parsing of their separators

    • zip

      default <O2> Parser<I,Tuple2<O,O2>> zip(Parser<I,O2> next)
      Right-zip a parser to this one.
      Type Parameters:
      O2 - the output type of next
      Parameters:
      next - the parser to zip to this one
      Returns:
      a new parser using this one then next, zipping the results in a tuple.

    • suffixed

      default Parser<I,O> suffixed(Parser<I,?> parser)
      Require a suffix for this parser.
      Parameters:
      parser - the suffix parser
      Returns:
      this parser, requiring the given parser to succeed after but still keeping the original output

    • prefixed

      default Parser<I,O> prefixed(Parser<I,?> parser)
      Require a prefix for this parser.
      Parameters:
      parser - the prefix parser
      Returns:
      this parser, requiring the given parser to succeed before but still keeping the original output

    • debug

      default Parser<I,O> debug(String name)
      Debugging decorator. Should eventually not be used in production but useful for debugging combinators.
      Returns:
      a new parser similar to this one printing input state and result/error in STDIN.

    • pure

      static <I, O> Parser<I,O> pure(O value)
      A parser returning the given result.
      Type Parameters:
      I - the input type of this parser (despite consuming nothing)
      O - the result type of this parser
      Parameters:
      value - the result
      Returns:
      a parser consuming no input and returning the given value

      Parse any token.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the token type
      Returns:

      Parse any of the given values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the token type
      Parameters:
      expected - the allowed tokens
      Returns:
      the parsed token if it is contained in expected

      Parse any of the given values.
      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the parsed token if it is contained in expected

    • lazy

      static <I, O> Parser<I,O> lazy(Supplier<Parser<I,O>> lazyParser)
      A lazy proxy for a parser. Useful for recursive parsers like the one used for syntactic processing.
      Type Parameters:
      I - the parser input
      O - the parser output
      Parameters:
      lazyParser - the parser supplier that will provide an instance when needed.
      Returns:
      a proxy for the given parser supplier

    • firstSucceeding

      static <I, O> Parser<I,O> firstSucceeding(Iterable<Parser<I,? extends O>> parsers)
      A parser returning the result of the first succeeding parser.
      Type Parameters:
      I - the parser input
      O - the common output type of each parser
      Parameters:
      parsers - the parsers to try.
      Returns:
      a parser trying each parser in the given order until one succeeds.

    • firstSucceeding

      @SafeVarargs static <I, O> Parser<I,O> firstSucceeding(Parser<I,? extends O>... parsers)
      A parser returning the result of the first succeeding parser.
      Type Parameters:
      I - the parser input
      O - the common output type of each parser
      Parameters:
      parsers - the parsers to try.
      Returns:
      a parser trying each parser in the given order until one succeeds.

    • matching

      static Parser<Character,String> matching(String regex)
      A parser matching a String with the given pattern.
      Parameters:
      regex - the pattern to match against
      Returns:
      a parser accepting the first group matching the given regex

    • keyword

      static Parser<Character,String> keyword(String word)
      An alphabetic keyword parser. For keyword "keyword": 
           keyword     //matches "keyword"
     keyword abc //matches "keyword"
     keyword()   //matches "keyword"
     keywordabc  //does not match
      Parameters:
      word - the keyword to parse
      Returns:
      a parser outputting the given keyword if the input matches it.
      See Also:
      • symbol(String)

    • symbol

      static Parser<Character,String> symbol(String symbol)
      A symbol parser. For symbol "+": 
           +     //matches "+"
     + abc //matches "+"
     +abc  //matches "+"
     +()   //matches "+"
     +=    //matches "+"
      Parameters:
      symbol - the keyword to parse
      Returns:
      a parser outputting the given symbol if the input matches it.
      See Also:
      • keyword(String)
